content: Why are perf runs done sequentially instead of parallelized across a few machines? Is it because the rustc-perf code would have to be redesigned somewhat and that hasn't happened yet?
wouldn't that cause the numbers to not be comparable anymore? What if the second machine is faster or has more memory?
Hmm, is the current machine cloud-hosted or is it dedicated?
doesn't seem to be a big issue anyway. the perf queue is shallow or empty most of the time
Yeah, there's no pressing reason to parallelize, and that would also make for a much more complex system than we have today.
It's not fundamentally impossible to do so though, just needs a lot of investment to pull off.
